post: Were thankful to Scholarship GPS for supporting BRIs Civics for Everyone initiative. Their courses and coaching help students and families secure scholarships, opening access to higher education without student debt. Learn how you can support our work: bit.ly/4jBYuQp  #CivicsForEveryone  #CollegeAccess  #Scholarships  #EdEquity  #StudentSuccess

Dont let the school year slip byjoin the Civic Star Challenge today. With just a few short steps, you can bring powerful civics lessons into your classroom and give your students the chance to shine. Why wait? 🔗  https://bit.ly/3V1CQuX  #CivicStarChallenge  #CivicEducation  #TeachingResources  #StudentEngagement

[My students] still have their Pocket Constitutions when theyre seniors.  – Jeffrey M., California educator Help teachers in your state engage students with the Constitution. Give now ➡️  https://bit.ly/40EsBAg  #CivicEducation  #CivicsChampion  #BackToSchool  #TeacherVoices

On 9/11/2001, firefighters showed courage and self-sacrifice in the face of tragedy. Today, we honor those virtues. Watch our video to see how their story connects to civic duty, and use the full lesson in your classroom. 🔗 Read here:  https://bit.ly/3Rg558w  #NeverForget  #CivicEducation  #CivicVirtues  #September11

As America approaches its 250th anniversary, the Civic Star Challenge helps students connect history to their own civic identity. Bring the ideals of 1776 into your classroom with flexible lessons and real-world impact. 🔗  https://bit.ly/3V1CQuX  #America250  #CivicStarChallenge  #CivicEducation  #TeachingResources  #CivicLearning

Meet William Mar, the 2025 MyImpact Challenge Grand Prize Winner. His Reach Through Rackets  project brings free tennis clinics to children with disabilities, building skills, confidence, and community. 🎥 Watch his interview with BRIs Emma Grahn:  https://bit.ly/45VQC8T  #CivicEducation  #MyImpactChallenge  #StudentVoice  #CivicVirtues

Teachers + parents: The Florida MyImpact Challenge Civics Fair is a chance for students to showcase service projects or pitch ideas for their communities. Theyll build leadership skills, meet AP Gov applied civics requirements, and compete for prizes. 📅 Oct. 11 | Register:  https://bit.ly/45YV1rx Florida MyImpact Challenge is hosted by the Bill of Rights Institute thanks to our sponsor Travelers.  #CivicEducation  #FloridaStudents  #YouthLeadership  #MyImpactChallenge  #ServiceLearning

Carrot-Top Industries, Inc. just debuted a new Freedom and Glory podcast episode featuring Bill of Rights Institutes VP of Content, Kirk Higgins. Kirk discusses civic education, student engagement, and the enduring meaning of the Star-Spangled Banner. 🔗  https://bit.ly/4nsjvQ5  #FreedomAndGloryPod  #CivicEducation  #TeachingResources  #StudentEngagement

📜  #OTD in 1996, Rosa Parks was awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom, honoring her pivotal role in the civil rights movement. How can we help students see the connection between individual courage and civic change? Use this lesson on Parks legacy:  https://bit.ly/3JJmmn7  #TDiH  #BRI250  #CivicEducation  #CivilRights  #CivicVirtues

Congratulations to Veronica Pitts, finalist for BRIs National Civics Teacher of the Year! At Selma High School, she turns constitutional principles into lived practice: debate, service, and action civics grounded in primary sources. 🔗  https://bit.ly/4goPm1B  #CivicEducation  #CivicTeachers  #TeacherRecognition  #StudentEngagement
